review_title: Under New Management... prepare for a 10 year bumpy road!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Casa Grande, AZ
pros: The company's heart is in the right place. They want to provide quality healthcare to all. They are a true benefit to the community!
cons:
Benefits are expensive! 
They have failed for years to negotiate meaningful benefits. Decision-makers think they are competitive in salary, but the employee's salary ends up being 8-10k less than their actual annual salary.

CEO is condescending and doesn't seem moved about it. Meanwhile, some of the key members of leadership are more interested in self-promotion than wanting to resolve key issues with patient care.

review_title: i really enjoyed working at Sun Life but disappointed with policies and procedures that used not for your benefit.
pros: enjoyed the working with the staff. My job as maintenance/ materials was very fulfilling. this was certainly one of the best jobs that I ever had.
cons: at times duties get overwhelming like any other job but even though I would ask for help, my supervisor along with the director of operations would rather come down on me than assist or get me help. occasionally you will get commendation for certain  tasks and the other times the credit is given to someone else. or should I say taken by someone else. i was terminated without ever being warned or written for anything and when I grieved my termination and had solid evidence that I was wrongfully terminated they have their process set up so that it is a lose lose situation for the employee. HR was in my defense with proof of the whole scenario only to be fired herself. very unfair.

pros: Great vacation benefit if you can stay longer than 2 years however high turn over rate because management would fire anyone that appears to be a threat to them.  (etc. generating too much revenue). However ,the  technicians are amazing. They are nice and helpful as long as you treat them right and look out for them.
cons: Management abuses their power and would make you work through your lunch break. If you are a floater, they would make you travel during your lunch break from one pharmacy to the next. Keep in mind that the closest pharmacy is 30 minutes from each other . On average the pharmacy is about 1-3 hours away from each other. They do not provide continuing education courses even if it's relevant to your job. They will not invest in your clinical skills and that any CE classes you want to take, you have to do it on your time.
Schedule wasnt that good. Had to drive to cover different locations. Lab supervisor wouldnt treat everyone the same with scheduling.

pros: Great patient population, patient orientated. Wonderful team of providers and ancillary staff.
cons: Seniority not recognized or valued. Disregard for employees dedication and loyalty.
